title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
The S&P 500 edged up 0.1% to notch its 50th record close of 2021, while the Nasdaq rose 0.5% to finish above 15000 for the first time. The Dow gained 0.1%.

Walmart is opening its in-house delivery platform to other businesses to allow contractors delivering the retailer's goods to make additional deliveries en route.

Waymo is opening its driver-supported robotaxis in San Francisco to selected riders, an important test for the Google sister company's technology and business.

Disney reached a deal with unions representing employees at Disney World in Florida that will require workers to show proof of Covid-19 vaccinations.

AMC Networks CEO Josh Sapan is stepping down. Former Showtime Chairman Matthew Blank was named interim chief.

Yale University named Matthew Mendelsohn as the next head of its more than $31 billion endowment.

TPG has hired JPMorgan and Goldman to underwrite its planned IPO.

What's News: Business & Finance
